title: E. Neveu, Assistant Professor
text:
I am an assistant professor at the Institute of Energy and Environment of HES-SO Valais-Wallis.
Since June 2024 I am responsible of the STREAM partnership, which aims is to foster innovation in digitization for water management
I am also collaborating at Hydro Alps.
Studying and working in an transdisciplinary environment has always been as much a challenge as an evidence for me, since my main driver is helping progress in natural science. As a numerical mathematician and computer scientist, I previously worked on multi resolution algorithms and data assimilation for physical oceanography. I switched to computational biology working on the combination of data and physics laws to better understand and predict complex molecular behaviors.
I love to adjust the abstract world of the mathematics to realistic constraints while creating links and transfer between disciplines and researchers.
You will find soon on this website my list of publications and a portfolio of the research projects.



Water management, Scientific Computing, Data science and Artificial intelligence, Optimization, Science Communication

title: Maths for the Earth
text:
Being particularly interested in the impact of mathematics and computer science in natural and human sciences,  with Didier Bresch, I have coordinated a Think-tank project during the year 2013. The ‘MathsInTerre’ Research Think-tank was a project financed by the French National Research Agency (ANR), with the aim of making a contribution to a more systemic and integrated vision of the subject “Mathematics and the complexity of the Earth system”. Its ultimate goal was to stimulate discussion upstream of the definition of an action plan for the ANR.
Comparisons between French and other national research system are also made.
All the results and reports are available on mathsmonde.math.cnrs.fr.
